intro: Leptarrhena pyrolifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
